page.title: 06Walking Day, Mawdesley
page.content: Walking Day started in 1874. Since then all church officials and members have taken part. It always begins with a service in church. This is followed by a walk to Bispham, back through the village to the Black Bull pub and then back to church. A hymn is sung and then everyone goes to the field for tea and the fair. Every year it takes the same format. Several stops are made along the way for refreshments and for the morris dancers to perform. Walking Day always takes place on the second Saturday in July, and a full meal is provided. The marquee comes from Formby, and the hire firm erects it. The fair comes from Bolton. The fair arrives a week before Walking Day and it leaves a week after. The church council organises the event.
